author: Staff Reporter
text:
Over 2,000 children have received cochlear implants under the Chief Minister’s comprehensive health insurance scheme and are now pursuing their studies, said A. Ravikumar, professor of ENT at Sri Ramachandra University, at the 10{+t}{+h}anniversary of the programme, where dozens of children who had undergone the surgery participated, a press release said.

The children put up a programme showcasing their talent. Dr. Ravikumar also said that since the implant needed to be replaced in a few years, parents need to continue periodical check-ups for their children.
title: Cochlear implant programme
